e.name: Lightning Speaker: Boggs Labayen
e.sub: Defending the role of the design/er

f.name: Keynote Speaker: Dae Lee
f.sub: Understanding behavioral science to influence better design and team culture

l.name: Figma 101 (Session 1)
l.description: Figma is a web-based design application, with excellent wireframing, prototyping, and code-generation tools. It’s currently (arguably) the industry’s best interface design tool, with powerful features which helps teams collaborate on every phase of the design process. In Figma 101 you’ll learn the basics of creating simple interfaces from low to high fidelity wireframes. This is ideal for people who want to transition from photoshop or sketch and wants to learn the basics of wireframing.

m.name: Figma 101 (Session 2)
m.description: Figma is a web-based design application, with excellent wireframing, prototyping, and code-generation tools. It’s currently (arguably) the industry’s best interface design tool, with powerful features which helps teams collaborate on every phase of the design process. In Figma 101 you’ll learn the basics of creating simple interfaces from low to high fidelity wireframes. This is ideal for people who want to transition from photoshop or sketch and wants to learn the basics of wireframing.

n.name: Analyzing Qualitative Usability Tests
n.description: Analyzing Qualitative Usability Tests Synthesizing thick data gathered from usability tests can be overwhelming, so how do you start?  It actually depends on three things: where you are in the development cycle, if you’re in an agency or product environment and your experience in usability testing. In this lecture, Tin will teach you how to select the best analysis framework and how to synthesize your data. The lecture is a mix of individual and group activities. Tin will also review your work and provide feedback. Attendees must have experience in moderating qualitative usability test sessions.

o.name: UX Research Workshop
o.description: A practical workshop with hands-on learning on how to plan UX research applied to a problem. It will give an overview on specific qualitative methods and will cover biases and assumptions.  In-depth exercises on interview discussion guides, interviewing, downloading data, and insights will give attendees practical tools to use in their work. It will also cover topics of how to start/build a research team and what happens with you have a lot of data. This workshop is for people with some UX experience.

p.name: Quantifying the User Experience
p.description: This workshop is about working backwards from the most common questions and problems you’ll encounter as you conduct, analyze, and report on user research projects. This is ideal for people working on projects who want to expand their team’s use of quantitative data and demonstrate impact, but aren’t sure where to start.

q.name: Design Thinking: Double Diamond Process
q.description: Integrating the Double Diamond approach in Design Thinking aims to introduce two ways of thinking into the methodology: Divergent and Convergent thinking. This expands on the effectivity of the design process, and gives us more confidence that we are solving the right problem, and are solving them right. By the end of the workshop, participants are expected to have the base knowledge they need to approach problems and solutions through divergent-to-convergent thinking. This workshop is best fit for those with a working knowledge of Design Thinking. This is also recommended for product owners/managers, or for design teams looking for a more structured approach in their design process.

c.name: Keynote Speaker: Micael Diaz de Rivera

d.name: Keynote Speaker: Dae Lee
d.sub: Understanding behavioral science to influence better design and team culture

e.name: Keynote Speaker: Patricia Ibasco
e.sub: Jump-starting UX in Organizations: Building the engine that keeps your UX team running

j.name: Figma 101
j.sub: Oscar Valles, Edzel Rubite, Jake Mapalo & Clint Bustrillow
j.description: Figma is a web-based design application, with excellent wireframing, prototyping, and code-generation tools. It’s currently (arguably) the industry’s best interface design tool, with powerful features which helps teams collaborate on every phase of the design process. In Figma 101 you’ll learn the basics of creating simple interfaces from low to high fidelity wireframes. This is ideal for people who want to transition from photoshop or sketch and wants to learn the basics of wireframing.

k.name: Creating Actionable Customer Journey Map
k.description: Customer journey map is a powerful tool that combines storytelling and visualisation to help the team understand the customer’s needs. It is essential to make the ideal journey a reality. This workshop is a combination of lecture, games and hands on practical application of journey mapping. It is ideal for people who would like to improve the end to end customer experience. People who are working on an application or a website can also benefit by having a perspective on the overall customer experience. Having basic knowledge in User Experience or Customer Experience is an advantage but not a prerequisite for attending this workshop.

l.name: Applying Usability Testing Principles in the Workplace
l.description: Usability Testing is a way for designers and solution providers to validate their ideas — made tangible by prototyping — with real users. In this workshop, participants will learn about the basics of Usability Testing, through interactive lecture and hands-on activities. There will also be tips on how to apply Usability Testing principles to our day-to-day work.

c.name: Keynote Speaker: Micael Andrei Diaz de Rivera
c.sub: UX for Designers, Developers, and Anyone in Between

f.name: Keynote Speaker: Ely Apao
f.sub: Designing your UX Career & Forming Design Teams

j.name: Figma 101
j.description: Figma is a web-based design application, with excellent wireframing, prototyping, and code-generation tools. It’s currently (arguably) the industry’s best interface design tool, with powerful features which helps teams collaborate on every phase of the design process. In Figma 101 you’ll learn the basics of creating simple interfaces from low to high fidelity wireframes. This is ideal for people who want to transition from photoshop or sketch and wants to learn the basics of wireframing.

k.name: UX 101
k.description: This workshop will cover the basics and many components of User Experience. You will learn about the design process, different roles and benefits of doing UX. By the end of the workshop, participants will have a clear understanding of UX and what it takes to create Good User Experience.

m.name: Building a UX Career Matrix for Students
m.description: If you’re coming from a field thats not really called “UX”, how might we actually build a career towards Design? In this workshop, we hope to help students from Computing, Psych and other allied fields prepare their portfolio, map their careers all the way to planning their thesis in order to launch that ux career in the future. At the end of this workshop, participants get to accomplish their career matrix (instead of a roadmap) and their journey map towards it.
